alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 3:19PM EDT until July 16 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BERGEN COUNTY... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across the warned area has moved out of the warning area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding remains ongoing, however flood waters are expected to slowly recede. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rutherford, Ridgefield, Teterboro, Palisades Park, Fairview, Ridgefield Park, Hasbrouck Heights, Wallington, Little Ferry, East Rutherford, Wood-Ridge, Carlstadt and Moonachie. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
